turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: What you say your name was?

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: This is the edge, boy.  This is the end.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Buzz?  What are we doing this for?

turns.speaker: BUZZ
turns.text: We got to do something.  Don't we?

turns.speaker: CHIEF
turns.text: We heard firing.  He get anybody? You alone?

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: We got a cookaboo inside.  He wounded some kid earlier.

turns.speaker: MOOSE
turns.text: Nothing, Crunch.  They picked him up like the rest of--

turns.speaker: CRUNCH
turns.text: He's going to cheese, I tell you. Nobody arrested him!

turns.speaker: MOOSE
turns.text: I think I should go home.

turns.speaker: CRUNCH
turns.text: No.  We're going to bring him down.

turns.speaker: MOOSE
turns.text: Crunch--my father's--You going to kill him?

turns.speaker: CRUNCH
turns.text: You clean out of your head?  Come on!

turns.speaker: CRUNCH
turns.text: Hang loose.  We got all night.

turns.speaker: MOOSE
turns.text: That maid saw us.  She could identify us too.

turns.speaker: CRUNCH
turns.text: You still want to go home, Moose?

turns.speaker: CRUNCH
turns.text: Then shut your mouth before your guts run out!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Tell him why we moved here.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: You mind if I try?  You have to slam the door in my face?  I try to get to him--what happens?  Don't I give you everything you want?  A bicycle--you get a bicycle. A car--

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You buy me many things.  Thank you.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Not just buy!  You hear all this talk about not lovely your kids enough.  We give you love and affection, don't we?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: My first day of school, mother'd make me eat and by golly I could never even swallow till recess--

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: So long, young fella.  Knock 'em dead, like your old man used to!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Sure--  You know something?  I have a feeling we're going to stay here.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: And listen--watch out about the pals you choose--Know what I mean? Don't let them choose you--

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: It's just this get-up.  The girl's out and I was bringing Mom's supper.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: I better clean this up before she sees it.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Listen--I took a steak out of the freezer.  I thought we could have a real old-fashioned stag party--just the two of us, what do you say?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Hey--I want to ask you something.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Suppose you knew that you had to do something very dangerous--where you have to prove something you need to know--a question of honor.  Would you do it?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Is there some kind of trick answer?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: I wouldn't do anything hasty. Let's get a little light on the subject.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: How'd that happen!  What kind of trouble you in?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: The kind we've been talking about. Can you answer me now?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Listen--nobody should make a snap decision--This isn't something you just--we ought to consider all the pros and cons--

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: We'll make time.  Where's some paper.  We'll make a list and if we're still stuck then we ought to get some advice--

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: What can you do when you have to be a man?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Just give me a direct answer!  You going to stop me from going, Dad?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: You know I never stop you from anything.  Believe me--you're at a wonderful age.  In ten years you'll look back on this and wish you were a kid again.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Ten years?  Now, Dad--I need an answer now!

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: I just want to show you how foolish you are.  When you're older you'll laugh at yourself for thinking this is so important--

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I'm in terrible trouble.--You know that big high bluff near Miller- town Junction?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Sure--there was a bad accident there.  They showed the pictures on T.V.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Will you let him tell it!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: She never wants to hear.  She doesn't care!

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Well, just get it off your chest, son.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: That's not what I mean.  I've never done anything right.  I've been going around with my head in a sling for years...I don't want to drag you into this but I can't help it.  I don't think I can prove anything by going around pretending I'm tough any more, so maybe you look like one thing but you still feel like another.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Are you listening to me?  You're involved in this!  I want to go to the police and tell them I was mixed up in this thing tonight?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You don't want me to go.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: You know you did wrong.  That's the main thing, isn't it?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: No!  It's nothing!  Just nothing! You always told me to tell the truth.  You think you can just turn that off?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: You'll learn as you get a little older, Jim.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I don't want to learn that!

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Son--this is all happening so fast--

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You better give me something, Dad. You better give me something  Mom?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: And you can depend on me, son. Trust me.  Whatever comes we'll face it together, I swear.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: I don't see what's so bad about taking a little drink.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: No.  I definitely don't.  I did the sa--

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: He's a minor, Mr. Stark, and it looks to me like he had more than a little drink.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Whoa!  Whoa!  I know you're a little upset but--

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What about you, Jim?  Got anything to say for yourself?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: I think I know my son.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: I guess I cut pretty loose in my day too.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Listen--can't you wait till we get home?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Can't you answer?  What's the matter with you anyhow?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Let me just explain to you--we just moved here, y'understand?  The kid has no friends yet and--

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Was it because we went to that party?  You know what kind of drunken brawls those parties turn into-- it's no place for kids.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: A minute ago you said you didn't care if he drinks.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: I guess when I nearly died giving birth to you--that shows how much I don't care!

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Did anyone see you there?  I mean did they get your license number or anything?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Look Jim.  Far be it from me to tell you what to do, but there's--

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Are you going to preach now?  Are we going to have a sermon?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: I'm just explaining what you mean! You can't be an idealist all your life!  Nobody thanks you for sticking your neck out!

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: I don't know.  First I thought it was Jim but--

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: He's home.  I heard the car.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: I still think you should go down.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: No, honey.  No, he's not here.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Stay here.  That was my son!

turns.speaker: NEGRO WOMAN
turns.text: She keep it to protect herself, sir. She scared without a man in the house.

turns.speaker: NEGRO WOMAN
turns.text: They not together, sir.  We don't see him in a long time now.

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Do you hear from him, son?

turns.speaker: NEGRO WOMAN
turns.text: Oh, Mrs. Crawford don't believe in them!

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Do you know why you shot those puppies, John?  Is that what they call you or do you have a nickname?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Can you tell me why you killed the puppies, Plato?

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: No, sir.  I just went next door to look at them like I always do. They were nursing on their mother and I did it.  I guess I'm just no good?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: What do you think's going to happen, you do things like that?

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: I don't know.  End up in the electric chair?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: Where did you get the gun?

turns.speaker: GENE
turns.text: You know if the boy ever talked to a psychiatrist?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Excuse me--but--You know where I can find--I mean I don't remember his last name--

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I think his first name's Ray--I have to see him.  It's very important.

turns.speaker: SERGEANT
turns.text: He's not here.  He's not at Juvenile Hall.  I don't know where he is.  He's out on a call and he'll be out all night.  How old are you?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: My parents know I'm out.  They know I'm here.

turns.speaker: SERGEANT
turns.text: Why don't you come back tomorrow, son?  Ever been booked before?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Once you been up there, you know you been some place!

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: He's a wheel.  So's she.  It's hard to make friends with them.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I don't want to make friends.

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: Listen, I told you not to fool with them.  Now they're waiting for you.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I know.  That's why I came back.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I saw it.  Gee, look at that thing swing, will you?  Do you think it never stops?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Oh, I bet some little guy comes in here at night and pushes it.  Go- go-go!

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: Jim--Do you think when the end of the world comes it'll be at night?

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: Are you really going to meet them?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Boy, I bet you'd go to a hanging.

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: My personality's showing again. Should I leave?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I got to go in.  You better get home too.  Hey--what?

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: Why don't you come home with me?  I mean nobody's home at my house--and I'm not tired, are you?  I don't have many--people I can talk to.

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: If you want to come we could talk and then in the morning we could have breakfast like my dad used to--  Gee...if you could only have been my father...we could...

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Hey...you flipped--or something? You better take off...

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: O.K.  G'night.  I got to pick up my scooter.  See you tomorrow.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: How'd you find me?  What's happening?

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: Everybody!  Crunch and Goon and everybody!  I think they're going to kill you.

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: They think you told the police on them.  They--who's in there?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Come out come out wherever you are!

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: We're safe here.  I hope.  What do you think?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Wowee ow wow!  Let's take it for the summer.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Nobody talks to children!  They just tell them one thing and mean another.

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: It's wonderful that you understand so well--and so young too!  You know the most wonderful feature about the nursery?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Let's see how long we can stay under.

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: Haven't you noticed your personality splitting?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: How do you know so much about this junk, Plato?

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: I had to go to a head-shrinker.  I only went twice though.  My mother said it cost too much, so she went to Hawaii instead.

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: When I was here?  When I ran away. I used to run away a lot but they always took me back.

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: Mom and Dad.  I used to be in my crib and I'd listen to them fight.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You remember that far back?  Boy, I can't even remember yesterday.

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: What you run out on me for!  What you leave me alone for?

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: I don't want you for my father!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You crazy nut!  You crazy, crazy nut!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Boy, I'm blind as a bat!  You got a match?  I'm going to break my neck in here.  Where are you?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I know.  Light a match, will you?

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: You think the end of the world will come at nighttime, Jim?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I just have a feeling.  Where are you?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Well, stop hiding and stand up.  I can't talk to you if I don't see you.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I'm not going to hurt you. PLATO Why did you run out on me?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: We didn't run out.  We were coming right back.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Sure I'm sure.  Judy's waiting. You ready to come out now?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I promise nothing'll happen if you do.  You want my jacket?  It's warm.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You want to give me your gun now, Plato?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: In your pocket.  Give it to me.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You trust me, don't you?  Just give it to me for a second.

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: You promised to give it back.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Friends never break promises, do they?  Okay.  Here.  Now listen.  There are a lot of people outside and they all want you to be safe.  You understand that?  They said I could come in and bring you out.

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: I shot at one of them.

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: Those aren't my friends.  Make them go away.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Ray!  Will you tell these guys to move back?

turns.speaker: PLATO
turns.text: Keep away from me!  I don't believe you anymore!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Stop tearing me apart!  You say one thing and he says another and then everybody changes back--

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: That's a fine way to behave!

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Sit down and eat--you'll be late.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: It'd stick in my throat, Mom.  I'm nervous or something--

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: What happened, darling.  We were so worried.  I was going to take a sleeping pill, but I wouldn't till I knew you were home.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I have to talk to someone, Mom.  I have to talk to you both.  And Dad this time you got to give me an answer.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: It doesn't matter how.  I was driving a stolen car--

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Do you enjoy doing this to me or what--

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: And you wanted him to make a list!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I told you Dad, it was a question of honor.  They called me chicken-- you know, chicken!  I had to go or I would never have been able to face any of those kids again.  So I got in one of these cars and a boy called Buzz got in the other.  We had to drive fast and jump before the cars went over the edge of the bluff.  I got out okay but Buzz didn't.  He was killed.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I can't keep it to myself anymore--

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: What about the other boys--Do you think they'll go to the police?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: What's that got to do with it?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Why should you be the only one.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: No!  I don't want you to go to the police!  There were other people and why should you be the only one involved!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: But I am involved!  We're all involved, Mom!  A boy was killed! I don't see how we can get out of that by pretending it didn't happen!

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: He's not saying that!  He's saying don't volunteer!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Just tell a little white lie?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Well, it doesn't matter anyhow-- because we're moving.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: No!  You're not tearing me loose any more.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Do I have to spell it out?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You're not going to use me as an excuse again, Mom.  Every time you can't face yourself you want to move and you say it's because of me or the neighborhood or some other phony excuse.  Now I want to do one thing right and I'm not letting you run away.  Dad?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Jimmy, you're very young--and a foolish decision now could wreck your whole life.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Dad--answer her--aren't you going to stand up for me?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Someone should put poison in her epsom salts.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Hang loose, boy.  I'm warning you.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Big tough character.  You don't kid me, pal.  How come you're not wearing your boots?
